scenes.description: Inside a dimly lit, upscale office, an older man with dark skin, a graying beard, and a dark suit with a yellow tie sits behind an ornate desk, exuding stern authority. Across from him stands a younger man with medium skin, dark hair, and a dark green suit jacket, who listens intently.
interactions: Gerald Olin: 'Yes, four. After the last one, I forbade any guests from checking into 1408 ever again.' He speaks with a serious, focused expression, his gaze unwavering.

scenes.description: Both men stand, facing each other in the office. The tension is palpable as they maintain eye contact. The camera pans as the two men walk slowly through the office, surrounded by bookshelves and antique décor. The younger man holds a notepad or small recorder, his demeanor shifting from confident to slightly uneasy.

Mike Enslin: 'Three mutilations, two stranglings.' The younger man interjects, demonstrating his own knowledge, his expression neutral but intent.

Mike Enslin: 'General Manager Gerald Olin is well-versed in the hotel's tragic history, dryly reciting the docket of carnage like a bookkeeper discussing his ledger.' He speaks almost as if narrating, his tone edged with irony.
Gerald Olin: 'Well, you think you're clever, don't you? I know the game.' Olin's voice is low, tinged with annoyance and challenge.
